availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Clay County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Married to Tabitha Davison Baker. Father of Mahala Baker, Lucinda Baker, James Baker, Andrew Baker, Ibby Baker, Daniel Baker, and Solomon Baker. Farmer in Clay County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Clay County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, Kentucky District, p. 121A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, p. 81.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, Precinct 9, p. 229B.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 13198.
